MGT293.name: Cooperative Education for Business Students
MGT293.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MGT293.description: Integration of pre-professional educational employment experiences in industry and government with knowledge and processes taught in the student's academic program. Educational employment assignment approved by the Department of Supply Chain Management.

MGT315.name: Managing Human Resources and Organizational Behavior
MGT315.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT315.description: Formulation and administration of human resource policies in the business enterprise. Personnel planning, job analysis and evaluation, staffing. Compensation and labor relations. Employee safety. Training, development, and performance appraisal. Issues of diversity and ethics.
MGT315.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Accounting major or in the Finance Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT325.name: Management Skills and Processes
MGT325.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT325.description: Managerial skills and processes in goal-directed institutions.
MGT325.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors and not open to students in the Accounting major or in the Finance Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Business-Preference major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major.

MGT352.name: Entrepreneurship: New Venture Process
MGT352.description: Becoming an entrepreneur. Developing successful business ideas. Moving from an idea to an entrepreneurial firm. Managing and growing an entrepreneurial firm.
MGT352.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Retail Management Minor and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT371.name: Retail Planning and Buying
MGT371.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MGT371.description: Role of a retail buyer in consumer products/fashion industries. Market and trend research, target customer needs, assortment planning, strategic buying, international sourcing, merchandise planning and control, and product development.
MGT371.restrictions: Open to students in the Retail Management Minor or approval of department.

MGT393.name: Introduction to International Business
MGT393.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT393.description: Introduction to the context of international business delivered on-site in foreign settings. Fundamental concepts and principles of globalization such as multinational corporations, foreign markets and economies, internal and external market transactions, international law, cultural influences, and multinational business strategies.
MGT393.restrictions: Open to students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT409.name: Business Policy and Strategic Management
MGT409.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT409.description: Techniques for building and maintaining consistent and effective policy and strategy. Major functions within a firm. Strategic integration, ethics, and international competition.
MGT409.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to undergraduate students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT411.name: Organizational Staffing
MGT411.description: Job and organizational analysis. Personnel planning, recruitment, selection and placement. Employment interviewing and testing. Validation of selection procedures, equal opportunity employer (EEO) guidelines, and affirmative action. Issues and diversity of ethics.
MGT411.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Retail Management Minor or in the Sports Business Management Minor and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT412.name: Compensation and Reward Systems
MGT412.description: Designing compensation systems. Job evaluation, internal and external equity. Pay-for-performance plans and financial incentives. Wage and salary surveys. Benefits administration. Diversity and ethical considerations.
MGT412.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Retail Management Minor or in the Sports Business Management Minor and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT413.name: Personnel Training and Development
MGT413.description: Designing and implementing training and development programs. Career stages and career planning. Needs analysis. Experimental design and program evaluation. Learning theories. Issues and diversity of ethics.
MGT413.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Retail Management Minor and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT414.name: Diversity in the Workplace
MGT414.description: Problems experienced by racial, ethnic, physically disabled, and other minorities in work organizations. Awareness training for managers. Ethical issues.
MGT414.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Retail Management Minor or in the Sports Business Management Minor and not open to students in the Hospitality Business Major.

MGT418.name: Labor-Management Relations
MGT418.description: Contextual framework of employment relations in union and non-union settings; history and labor law; environmental influences and employer and organized labor strategies; collective bargaining process including negotiations; grievance administration and arbitration; public sector employment relations.
MGT418.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Accounting major or in the Finance Major or in the Marketing Major or in the Supply Chain Management Major or in the Business - Admitted major or in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Retail Management Minor or in the Sports Business Management Minor and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT460.name: Capstone for Management Majors (W)
MGT460.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MGT460.description: Topics in management and organizational behavior.
MGT460.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Human Resource Management Major or in the Management Major or in the Retail Management Minor or in the Sports Business Management Minor.

MGT474.name: Negotiations
MGT474.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MGT474.description: Strategic negotiation, negotiation preparation, buyer-supplier relationship assessment, international negotiations, and negotiation simulation.
MGT474.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Supply Chain Management Major or approval of department.

MGT475.name: Negotiation and Conflict Management
MGT475.description: Negotiation and bargaining to manage people and interpersonal relations. Developmental processes, stages, and types of conflict. Conflict management and resolution.
MGT475.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business or approval of department.

MGT476.name: Globalization and International Management
MGT476.description: International management issues, including national culture, leadership, decision making, team performance, communication, negotiations, structure, and personal career implications of international management.
MGT476.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business or approval of department.

MGT479.name: Sports Business Management
MGT479.description: Introduction to current sports industry landscape and impact of business on decision-making in sports. Focus on trends in intercollegiate athletics and professional sports including careers, governance, organizational structure, revenue and sports entertainment.
MGT479.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Sports Business Management Minor or approval of department.

MGT490.name: Independent Study
MGT490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT490.description: Supervised program of independent library research designed to supplement classroom study.
MGT490.restrictions: Open to seniors. Approval of department.

MGT491.name: Special Topics in Management
MGT491.description: Topics in management such as advanced organizational behavior, managing labor relations, organizational development, organizational theory and design, strategic leadership and decision making.
MGT491.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or in the Retail Management Minor or in the Sports Business Management Minor and not open to students in the School of Hospitality Business.

MGT493A.name: Sports Business: Internship
MGT493A.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT493A.description: Supervised, professional work or internship experience in the field of sports business with intercollegiate athletics or professional sports associations, firms, leagues, organizations, teams or sports business and entertainment companies.
MGT493A.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Sports Business Management Minor or approval of department.

MGT493B.name: Sports Business: Fieldwork Seminar
MGT493B.description: Leadership in day-to-day operations, decision making, strategic planning alongside industry leader in sports business. Hands-on projects in intercollegiate athletics, professional sports or applicable associations, firms or leagues. Rotational exposure to unit(s) and/or executive(s) within organization. Behind the scenes experience and knowledge of industry through real-time projects and solution-focused problem solving.
MGT493B.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Sports Business Management Minor or approval of department.

MGT801.name: Analyzing your Organization
MGT801.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT801.description: Analysis of the student's organization focusing on issues related to the management of people, group processes, and organizational design. Review of various aspects of their organizations' processes related to the management of people and suggest a plan for improving the effectiveness of those processes. Issues include motivation, diversity, leadership, group performance, and culture.
MGT801.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT802.name: Strategic Analysis
MGT802.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT802.description: Supervised analysis of the student's employing organization, focusing on interviewing the CEO or visible leader. Assessing the correspondence between the leader's vision and concepts presented in the program.
MGT802.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Management.

MGT804.name: International Management
MGT804.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MGT804.description: Management challenges and roles in a multinational business. Strategic planning in global firms, managing people in international organizations, leadership, and the future of international management.
MGT804.prerequisite: MBA 824 or (MGT 810 or MGT 824 or approval of department)
MGT804.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT805.name: Special Topics in Management
MGT805.description: Selected topics in current and emerging issues in management.
MGT805.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT810.name: Human Resource Management for General Managers
MGT810.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT810.description: Human resource management functions performed by all managers. Design, administration, and evaluation of human resource activities. Needs assessment, program implementation and evaluation, information management and decision support, and international human resource management.
MGT810.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT811.name: Fundamentals of Human Resource Staffing
MGT811.description: Fundamentals of human resource staffing. Legal issues; measurement, reliability, and validity; job analysis; performance assessment; and recruitment.
MGT811.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT812.name: Advanced Topics in Human Resource Staffing
MGT812.description: Initial assessment methods such as letters of recommendations and weighted application blanks. Substantive assessment methods such as cognitive ability, personality, integrity, and situational judgment tests. Structured interviews and assessment centers. Selection decision making.
MGT812.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT814.name: Managing Diversity in the Workplace
MGT814.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT814.description: Problems experienced by racial, ethnic, physically disabled, and other minorities in work organizations. Awareness training for managers.
MGT814.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT817.name: Managing the Learning Organization
MGT817.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT817.description: Assessing knowledge, skills, and abilities within the organization. Matching future employee skill needs with appropriate learning strategies. Linking employee knowledge, skills, and abilities with overall organizational strategies.
MGT817.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT818.name: Talent Management and Development
MGT818.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT818.description: The role of managing human resources to realize organizational goals and mission. Employee recruitment and development, performance management, succession planning, and retention strategies. Career management and leadership development.
MGT818.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT822.name: Developing Reward and Compensation Systems
MGT822.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT822.description: Application of compensation principles to organizational objectives. Strategic use of compensation systems for attracting, motivating, and retaining employees. Managerial aspects of paying employees at all organizational levels.
MGT822.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT824.name: Developing Managerial Skills
MGT824.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT824.description: The management of people, group processes, and organizational design. Theories and research are applied to developing managerial skills in motivation and leadership, with an understanding of diversity, organizational culture and structure.
MGT824.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT832.name: Foundations of Negotiation
MGT832.description: Fundamentals of effective negotiations through readings, simulations, videos, and discussions. Planning for negotiation, integrative and distributive negotiation strategies, power and influence, ethics and interpersonal communication. Experience in negotiating through simulations and follow-up discussions.
MGT832.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT833.name: Complex Negotiations and Dispute Resolution Systems
MGT833.description: Managing complex negotiations, such as mediated conflicts, coalitions, multiparty negotiations, cross-cultural negotiations, and dispute resolution system design. Unique challenges in complex negotiations and strategies to meet bargainers' interests in these negotiations.
MGT833.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT840.name: Leadership and Team Management
MGT840.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT840.description: Development of leadership abilities through readings and laboratory application.
MGT840.prerequisite: MBA 808 or (MGT 824 or approval of department)
MGT840.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT842.name: Leading A Strategy Change
MGT842.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT842.description: Issues related to role of leadership in the change process. Emphasis on the need for and execution of a change in strategy.
MGT842.restrictions: Open to master''s students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT850.name: Competitive and Business Strategy
MGT850.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT850.description: Concepts and methods that integrate previous training in functional areas of management. Total firm perspective and ways top managers create and sustain competitive advantage in today's challenging global marketplace.
MGT850.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT854.name: Global Strategy
MGT854.description: The course is designed to provide an overview of the basic building blocks of the strategic management process in a global setting; provide a framework for understanding how multinational companies manage and leverage competitive advantage across international markets.
MGT854.prerequisite: MGT 850 or MGT 858 or approval of department
MGT854.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT856.name: Corporate Strategy
MGT856.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT856.description: Management of multi-business firms, conglomerates and business groups. Mergers and acquisitions, firm scope, strategic alliances, corporate governance and strategic leadership.
MGT856.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT863.name: Negotiations
MGT863.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT863.description: Strategic negotiations, negotiation preparation, buyer-supplier relationship assessment, international negotiations, and negotiation simulation.
MGT863.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to students in the Master of Business Administration in Business Administration.

MGT872.name: Developing Competitive Strategy
MGT872.description: Strategy development and execution as a process. Identification of issues that both impede and improve the likelihood of successful strategies.

MGT873.name: Strategic Decision Making
MGT873.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT873.description: Process of strategic decision-making, identify issues that impede and improve decision success, examine a range of contextual factors that influence the decision process.
MGT873.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT875.name: Change Management
MGT875.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT875.description: Role and process of organizational change management. Types of change, identifying need for change, and change management process.
MGT875.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Department of Management or in the Department of Supply Chain Management.

MGT879.name: Strategic Management Consulting Projects
MGT879.description: Team-based, project-oriented course in which students work with a company to analyze a strategic issue facing the company. Development of a consulting engagement from project definition through a final report and recommendations.

MGT881.name: Creating an Ethical Organization
MGT881.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT881.description: Review factors that enhance and diminish ethical behavior in an organization, including the ethical dimensions of decision making, the nature of business ethics and the difference between ethical and legal behavior.
MGT881.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management and not open to MBA students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT888.name: Communication Strategies for Business
MGT888.description: Professional communication skills, from basic business writing techniques to cutting-edge digital and social-media strategies.
MGT888.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management. Approval of department.

MGT890.name: Independent Study
MGT890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MGT890.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT906.name: Organizational Research Methods
MGT906.description: Methods for scientific research in the areas of organizational behavior, personnel, and organizational theory. Theory building, hypothesis formation and testing, reliability theory, construct validity, external validity, research design.
MGT906.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT907.name: Seminar in Organizational Behavior
MGT907.description: Directed readings on the behavior of individuals within organizations. Theory and empirical research on perception, decision-making, work motivation, work attitudes, leadership and group dynamics.
MGT907.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT908.name: Seminar in Strategy Process
MGT908.description: Strategy development as a process that drives the parallel issues of formulation and implementation. Survey of theory and research in this area.
MGT908.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT909.name: Seminar in Human Resource Management
MGT909.description: Classic and current empirical research. Job analysis, personnel selection, training, and incentive systems.
MGT909.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT910.name: Seminar in Strategic Management
MGT910.description: Review of recent research literature. Topics include developments in strategic types, identification of strategic groups, strategy formulation, implementation, and decision making.
MGT910.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management or approval of department.

MGT912.name: Special Topics Research Seminar
MGT912.description: Research in timely and specialized topics in organizational behavior, organization theory, human research management, organizational policy and strategy.
MGT912.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Eli Broad College of Business and The Eli Broad Graduate School of Management.

MGT914.name: Advanced Organizational Research Methods
MGT914.description: Methods for empirically testing scientific theories in organizational contexts.

MGT999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
MGT999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
